title: 108_s2233
content: The Act may be cited as the "Environmental Research Enhancement Act". It pertains to Environmental Protection Agency research activities. The Environmental Research Enhancement Act establishes the position of Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency. The Deputy Administrator will be appointed by the President with the advice and consent of the Senate, considering recommendations from the National Academy of Sciences, National Academy of Engineering, and the Science Advisory Board. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology in the Environmental Protection Agency oversees the Office of Research and Development, Office of Environmental Information, Science Advisory Board, Science Policy Council, and scientific/technical activities. Recommendations are considered from the National Academy of Sciences, National Academy of Engineering, and the Science Advisory Board. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology at the Environmental Protection Agency is responsible for overseeing various scientific and technical activities within the agency, including the Office of Research and Development, Office of Environmental Information, Science Advisory Board, and Science Policy Council. They are also tasked with identifying important scientific issues, developing strategies for acquiring and disseminating scientific information, and collaborating with academia and other government agencies. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology at the Environmental Protection Agency is responsible for developing and overseeing an Agency-wide strategy to acquire and disseminate necessary scientific information through intramural and extramural programs involving academia, government agencies, and the private sector in the United States and foreign countries. They ensure that the complex scientific outreach and communication needs of the Agency are met, including reaching out to the broader scientific community for support. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology at the Environmental Protection Agency oversees scientific quality-assurance, peer-review activities, and ensures appropriate scientific information is used in decision-making at all levels within the Agency. They also coordinate Agency-wide policy deliberations and reach out to the scientific community for relevant knowledge. The Assistant Administrator for Research and Development at the Environmental Protection Agency is appointed for a 6-year term and ensures that scientific and technical information used in regulatory decisions is valid, characterized in terms of uncertainty, and appropriately applied. The Assistant Administrator for Research and Development at the Environmental Protection Agency is appointed for a 6-year term. A program is established to recruit senior researchers with distinguished achievements in environmental research for the Agency's laboratories. Awards are given to support research in advancing areas related to the Agency's mission and to train junior researchers. The program aims to make awards to senior researchers to support research in rapidly advancing areas related to the Agency's mission and to train junior researchers with exceptional promise. Selection procedures will be established, and awards will last for a 5-year period and may be renewed. Each laboratory must have at least one senior researcher appointed under the program. The Office of Research and Development will make awards to senior researchers for a 5-year period, with the possibility of renewal. Each laboratory must have at least one senior researcher appointed under the program. Appropriations are authorized as necessary. The Office aims to empower research managers with flexibility and accountability. The Office of Research and Development aims to empower research managers by allowing them to make decisions at the appropriate level, maintain a balance between core and problem-driven research, develop strategies for acquiring research from various sources, and improve decision-making transparency. The Office of Research and Development aims to improve decision-making processes by enhancing transparency in establishing priorities, making assignments, and allocating funds. The Administrator of the Agency is tasked with increasing efforts to disseminate research products, explain their significance, and assist in applying the results of projects. The Office of Research and Development aims to enhance transparency in decision-making processes by improving the science inventory of the Agency. This includes documenting and publishing detailed information on scientific activities conducted by Agency units, such as project goals, milestones, and allocations of resources. The Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology is directed to expand the inventory to ensure proper management of activities. The Deputy Administrator for Policy and Management at the Environmental Protection Agency is tasked with redesignating the position to enhance transparency in decision-making processes and ensure proper management of scientific activities through improved inventory documentation. This includes separating the management of work product development from peer review to maintain independence and avoid potential control by program managers. The position of Deputy Administrator at the Environmental Protection Agency is redesignated as "Deputy Administrator for Policy and Management" to enhance transparency and proper management of scientific activities. References to the Deputy Administrator in laws and records will now refer to the Deputy Administrator for Policy and Management. The Executive Schedule Level III is amended accordingly. The position of Deputy Administrator at the Environmental Protection Agency is renamed to "Deputy Administrator for Policy and Management" and "Deputy Administrator for Science and Technology" to improve transparency and management of scientific activities. The relevant laws and records will now refer to these new titles.
